org.gamelink.game

Class Kalah

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gamelink.game.Kalah

  • public class Kalah
extends java.lang.Object
    The Kalah class is used by an algorithm to play the Kalah game. The Kalah class attempts to connect the algorithms with each other and then proceeds to regulate the playing of the game. The Kalah class uses the Link class to send messages between the players of the game. The Kalah class is responsible for validating and applying moves made by the algorithm, as well as regulating the play of the games (who moves when).
    Since:
    2015-07-27

    • Field Detail

      • playerNumber

        public int playerNumber
        The playerNumber integer is used to identify each player of the game. This value is retrieved from the player prior to the start of the game. Player 1 is the host of the match and moves first, Player 2 is the client and connects to player 1 to start the game.

      • opponentPlayerNumber

        public int opponentPlayerNumber
        The opponentPlayerNumber Integer is used to identify the opponent player's number. It is always opposite if the playerNumber.

      • connection

        public Link connection
        The connection is an instance of the Link classes used to connect both algorithms over their local area network using the hosts IP address. A connection must be established prior to the start of the game

      • gameBoard

        public int[][] gameBoard
        The gameBoard is the integer representation of the Kalah Board used durring the playing of the game

      • turn

        public int turn
        The turn integer holds the player number of the players whose turn it is.

      • winner

        public int winner
        The winner integer hold the player number of the winner of the match.

      • CONFIGFILE

        public final java.lang.String CONFIGFILE
        The CONFIGFILE constant defines the file path of the Cram properties file. The properties file lists a series of properties that may be changed to alter aspects of the game to the users liking.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • timeLimitProperty

        public int timeLimitProperty
        The timeLimitProperty limits the amount of time (in seconds) an algorithm may take to make a move. Failing to meet this time restriction will result in an invalid move. This property is listed within the Cram.properties file and is set to 30 seconds by default.

      • MAXTIMELIMIT

        public final int MAXTIMELIMIT
        The MAXTIMELIMIT property is used to virtualy turn off the timeLimit; if the user specifies a time limit of 0 in the properties file the time limit will be set to the MAXTIMELIMIT value, essentialy turnning it off.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • displayBoardProperty

        public boolean displayBoardProperty
        The displayBoardProperty is a boolean setting that determines if the game is to display the gameBoard after each move of the match. This property is listed within the Cram.properties file and is set to true by default.

      • moveDelayProperty

        public int moveDelayProperty
        The MoveDelayProperty adds a delay (in seconds) between each move of the match allowing observers to keep up with the playing of the game. this property is listed within the Cram.properties file and is set to 3 seconds by default.

      • seedsPerCellProperty

        public int seedsPerCellProperty
        The SeedsPerCellProperty defines the number of seeds contained in each house at the start of the game. This Property is Listed in the Kalah.properties file and is set to 3 by default

      • boardWidth

        public int boardWidth
        The baordWidth values defines the width of the gameBoard and is derived from the housesPerPlayer property from the Kalah.properties file. by default this value is 7 (6 houses and 1 store)

      • boardHeight

        public int boardHeight
        The baordHeight values defines the Height of the gameBoard. It is always 2 for the game of Kalah

      • myScoreX

        public int myScoreX
        The myScoreX integer represents the x position of the players store on the gameBoard. This value is derived from the HousesPerPlayer property within the Kalah.properties file

      • enemyScoreX

        public int enemyScoreX
        The enemyScoreX integer represents the x position of the opponents store on the gameBoard.

      • mySide

        public int mySide
        The mySide integer represents the players side of the gameBoard

      • oppSide

        public int oppSide
        The oppSide integer represents the opponent players side of the gameBoard.

      • boardDisplay

        public org.gamelink.game.KalahDisplay boardDisplay
        The boardDisplay is an instance of the Display class used to display the gameBoard as a JFrame

      • painter

        public org.gamelink.game.KalahPainter painter
        The painter is an instance of the KalahPainter class that is used to paint the gameBoard on the JFrame

    • Constructor Detail

      • Kalah

        public Kalah()
        The Cram constructor is responsible for setting up everything needed for the game to start. This includes reading the properties from the config file and configuring the game accordingly. The constructor method prompts the user for their player number and sets the playerNumber and opponentPlayerNumber values accordingly. Additionally the constructor sets the playerNumber of the connection establishing the player as either the host or the client.

      • Kalah

        public Kalah(int pNum)
        This Cram constructor acts the same way as other Cram constructor however player number is passed as a parameter instead of command prompt.
        Parameters:
        The - playerNumber of the player
        See Also:
        Cram#Constrctor()

      • readConfigFile

        public void readConfigFile()
        The readConfigFile method reads and retrieves the properties from the Cram.properties file and sets the corresponding instance variables as specified in the file

      • initializeGame

        public void initializeGame()
        The initializeGame method is responsible for configuring the gameBoard and syncronizing both Players. The initial board is configured on player1 side, The board along with the properties of the game is then sent to player2 so they both begin with the game settings.Pplayer2 validates the received settings and responds with a message indicating that the validation was successful. Once complete the game may begin.

        Returns:

        Returns:
        true if the game is over, false otherwise.

      • areBoardsEqual

        public boolean areBoardsEqual(int[][] board1,
                     int[][] board2)
        The areBoardsEqual method compares two game boards to determine if they are equal, this method is used in the process of validating a move.
        Parameters:
        an - 2d integer representation of a game board
        another - 2d integer representation of a game board
        Returns:
        true if the boards are equal (same values), false otherwise.

      • arrayToString

        public java.lang.String arrayToString(int[][] board)
        The arrayToString methos converts a 2d integer array representation of a board to a string, allowing it to be sent via the Link connection. This method effectivly revearses the actions preformed in the stringToArray method.
        Parameters:
        The - 2d integer array representation of the board to be converted to a String.
        Returns:
        The string representation of the board, with values seppparated with the '|' character.
        See Also:
        Cram.stringToArray(String message)

      • stringToArray

        public int[][] stringToArray(java.lang.String message)
        The stringToarray method converts the String representation of a board to the 2d integer representation. This method effectivly reverses the actions performed in the arrayToString method.
        Parameters:
        The - String representation of the board to be converted to a 2d integer array.
        Returns:
        The 2d integer array representation of the game board
        See Also:
        Cram.arrayToString(int[][] board)

      • flipBoard

        public int[][] flipBoard(int[][] board)
        The flipBoard method rotates the gameBoard 180 degrees so that the current players side is always the bottom one.
        Returns:
        The 2d integer array representation of the gameBoard rotated 180 degrees

      • copyArray

      • moveToCell

        public int moveToCell(int move,
             int side)
        The moveToCell method converts the move entered by the users algorithm to the standard used by the 2d integer gameBoard.
        Parameters:
        The - move entered by the user in the form of a number from 1 to 6 (default)
        The - side of the board to which the move corresponds
        Returns:
        The x coordinate of the house corresponding to the move entered by the users algorithm.

      • constructMessage

        public java.lang.String constructMessage(java.lang.String move,
                                int[][] oldBoard,
                                int[][] newBoard,
                                int turn)
        The constructMessage method formats the message to be sent to the opponents, this message will represent the a move made by the player and will include the move, the game board before the move was applied, the game board after the move was applied and the player number of the player to move next
        Parameters:
        The - move made by the player in the form of a String
        The - board prior to applying the move in the form a 2d integer array.
        The - board after the application of the move in the form of a 2d integer array
        The - player number of the player to play next.
        Returns:
        The message to be sent to the opponent in the form of a String containing, the String representations of move, the old board, the new board and a number indicating the player to move next all sepatated by the ':' delimiter

      • constructInitialMessage

        public java.lang.String constructInitialMessage()
        The constructInitialMessages is responsible for formatting the message sent by player 1 to player 2 to syncronize the initial properties of the game. These properties include the number of cells per house, the width of the board, as well as the configuration of the gameBoard
        Returns:
        The message to be sent to player2 in the form of a String containing the String representation of the gameBoard, the seedsPerCellProperty, and the boardWidth all separated by the ':' delimiter

      • deconstructMessage

        public java.lang.String[] deconstructMessage(java.lang.String message)
        The deconstructMessage method is responsible for seggmenting the message sent by the opponent player into 3 parts.
        Parameters:
        The - message sent by the opponent to represent their move
        Returns:
        a array containing 4 Strings, the opponents move, the board before the opponent's move, and the board after the opponents move and the player number of the player whose turn it is.

      • validateAndApplyMove

        public boolean validateAndApplyMove(java.lang.String opponentMove,
                           int[][] opponentOldBoard,
                           int[][] opponentNewBoard,
                           java.lang.String whosTurn)
                             throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        The validateAndApplyMove method is used to validate the move sent by the opponent player. If the move is determined to be a valid move the move is then applied to the gameBoard
        Parameters:
        The - move made by the opponent in the form of a string
        The - opponents board prior to the move being applied
        The - opponents board after the move is applied
        The - player number of the player to move next
        Returns:
        true if the opponents move is a valid one and was successfully applied to the gameBoard, false if otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the move entered does not meet the standard (a 4 digit number)

      • validateAndApplyMove

        public boolean validateAndApplyMove(java.lang.String playerMove)
                             throws java.lang.NumberFormatException
        The validateAndApplyMove method is used to validate a move prior to it being sent to the opponent player. If the move is determined to be a valid move the move is then applied to the gameBoard and sent to the opponent
        Parameters:
        The - move made by the player in the form of a string
        Returns:
        true if the player's move is a valid one and was successfully applied to the gameBoard, false if otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NumberFormatException - if the move entered does not meet the standard (a 4 digit number)

      • validateProperties

        public void validateProperties(java.lang.String initSeeds,
                      java.lang.String width)
        The validateProperties method is used to validate the syncronization message sent by the opposing player. A response is then sent to the opposing player to signify if the properties match their own.
        Parameters:
        The - seeds per house property sent by the opposing player in the message
        The - baordWidth property sent by the opposing in the message

      • applyMove

        public boolean applyMove(int[][] board,
                int move,
                int side)
        The applyMove method applies a move made by one of the players to a game board.
        Parameters:
        The - board to which the move is applied to.
        The - move to be applied to the board.
        The - side of the board the move is to be applied.
        Returns:
        true if the player making the move is awarded another turn.

      • update

        public void update(int newTurn,
          java.lang.String move)
        The update method sets the value of the turn variable and updates the gameBoard displayed on the JFrame

      • startGame

        public void startGame(java.lang.Class<?> algo,
             boolean useOwnIpAddress)
        The startGame method attemps to establish a connection between player 1 and player 2 using the Link class. Once a connect is established the game is then started.
        Parameters:
        The - user-created class containing the algorithm which will act as a player of the game.
        A - boolean value signifying that the player wishes to connect to another player on the same IP addess
        See Also:
        Link

      • gameLoop

        public void gameLoop(java.lang.Class<?> algo)
        The gameLoop method is responsible for controlling the flow of the game. After the game is initialized using the initializeGame method, the players algorithms are called and moves are sent back and forth between players using the makeMove and SendMove methods
        Parameters:
        The - user-created class containing the algorithm which will act as a player of the game.

      • endGame

        public void endGame(java.lang.String move)
        The endGame method is used to clean up after the game. First any remianing seeds are removed, the final configuration of the gameBoard is then printed, followed by the reason why the game is over and the final score of the game. Finally the connection between the players in closed.
        Parameters:
        the - String represetation of the last move of the match.

      • makeMove

        public boolean makeMove(java.lang.String move)
        The makeMove method is responsible for validating, applying and sending a move made by the players algorithm.
        Parameters:
        The - move made by the players algorithm in String form.
        Returns:
        true if the game is over after the application of the move, false otherwise.

      • getMove

        public boolean getMove()
        The getMove method is responsible for retrieving, validating, and applying a move made by the opposing player's algorithm
        Returns:
        true if the game is over after the application of the move, false otherwise.

      • wipeBoard

        public void wipeBoard()
        The wipeBoard method is used at the end of a game to remove all remaining seeds left on the board and place them in the respective player's store

        public int getNextX(int y,
           int x)

      • getOppCell

        public int getOppCell(int x,
             int y)
        The getOppCell method is used to retrieve the house opposite of the current one. This is use in the event of stealing seeds from the opponent player.
        Parameters:
        The - x coordinate of the current house
        The - y coordinate of the current house
        Returns:
        The x coordinate of the opposing house

      • changeTurn

      • runAlgo

        public static java.lang.String runAlgo(java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                       Kalah game)
        The runAlgo method utalizes the CramAlgoInvoker Class to call the user-created algorithm. This algorithm returns the players move in the form of a String.
        Parameters:
        The - method representation of the user-created algorithm
        The - instance of the game of Cram currently being played
        Returns:
        The move returned by the users algorithm in the form of a String
        See Also:
        CramAlgoInvoker
